title: SnapDock — Markdown Workspace
description: A clean, fast Markdown reader built with pure JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. SnapDock provides a distraction-free workspace with file-tree navigation, multi-file viewing, and a polished ZFordDev interface.

features.title: File-Tree Navigation
features.description: Browse folders of Markdown files with a simple, responsive sidebar.

features.title: Multi-File Viewing
features.description: Open multiple documents and switch between them instantly.

features.title: Drag-and-Drop Support
features.description: Drop files or folders directly into SnapDock to load them immediately.

features.title: PDF Export (Planned)
features.description: Future support for exporting Markdown documents to clean, styled PDFs.

engineeringNotes: SnapDock is intentionally lightweight and dependency-free, built with native web technologies for maximum clarity and maintainability. The UI follows ZFordDev design principles: clean, minimal, and distraction-free. Cross-platform builds are planned once the underlying OS tooling is ready.

title: ZIA — Modular AI Assistant Framework
description: A proof-of-concept modular AI assistant that connects Slack, Discord, and a web interface to local or external AI models. Built to explore persona switching, persistent memory, and multi‑platform routing. ZIA now serves as the foundation for ALX‑ZIA — the next-generation hardware-first evolution of this architecture.

features.title: Slack & Discord Handlers
features.description: Unified message routing across multiple chat platforms.

features.title: Persona Templates
features.description: Switch between conversation styles using JSON-based persona configs.

features.title: Persistent Memory
features.description: Per-channel JSON memory storage with no database required.

features.title: Config-Driven Setup
features.description: All behavior controlled through JSON files — no code edits needed.

features.title: ALX‑ZIA Integration
features.description: ZIA is the software backbone that inspired and now connects to ALX‑ZIA, the hardware-first successor.

engineeringNotes: ZIA is intentionally raw — a prototype that laid the groundwork for ALX‑ZIA and ZiaStudio. It demonstrates routing, persona switching, and memory, but is not intended as a polished product.

title: ALX‑ZIA — Hardware‑First AI Assistant
description: ALX‑ZIA is the hardware‑first evolution of the original ZIA framework. Designed for dedicated rental devices, ALX‑ZIA focuses on privacy, modularity, and real‑world utility. While the original ZIA remains open-source, ALX‑ZIA is a proprietary system forming the backbone of the ALX ecosystem.

features.title: Hardware‑First Architecture
features.description: Optimized for dedicated devices, enabling low‑latency, private, local inference.

features.title: Modular Node System
features.description: Plug‑and‑play modules for sensors, inputs, outputs, and AI pipelines.

features.title: ZIA Compatibility Layer
features.description: Bridges the open-source ZIA prototype with the new ALX hardware ecosystem.

features.title: Local + Cloud Hybrid
features.description: Run models locally or route to external providers when needed.

features.title: Config‑Driven Design
features.description: All behavior defined through JSON and YAML configs — no code changes required.

engineeringNotes: ALX‑ZIA represents the shift from a software‑only prototype to a hardware‑anchored AI system. It inherits routing, persona, and memory concepts from ZIA, but expands them into a distributed, device‑driven architecture. ALX‑ZIA is closed-source and distributed exclusively on ALX rental devices.

title: NestKey — Secure Password Vault
description: A lightweight, offline password vault built with pure JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. NestKey focuses on local-first security with no cloud storage, no telemetry, and full user control.

features.title: Local-Only Storage
features.description: All credentials are stored offline on your device. No cloud sync, no external servers.

features.title: AES-256 Encryption
features.description: All vault data is encrypted using industry-standard AES-256.

features.title: Master Password Lock
features.description: Secure your vault with a single master password.

features.title: Auto-Fill (Planned)
features.description: Future browser extension for seamless login workflows.

engineeringNotes: NestKey is intentionally simple and transparent, built with native web technologies for maximum auditability. Encryption is handled client-side, ensuring that sensitive data never leaves the user's machine. Cross-platform packaging will be added once OS tooling is ready.

title: Networking & Systems — ZFordDev Infrastructure
description: The internal infrastructure powering ZFordDev: secure networking, home-lab servers, API tooling, and a disciplined deployment workflow designed for reliability, transparency, and future scalability.

features.title: Secure Home-Lab Architecture
features.description: Ubuntu 24.04 LTS servers running behind managed switches, custom firewall rules, and isolated virtual networks.

features.title: API & Internal Tooling (ZIA)
features.description: Local-first API services powering automation, client workflows, and internal dashboards.

features.title: Controlled Deployment Pipeline
features.description: Git → Syncthing → Server workflow ensuring only reviewed, approved files reach production.

features.title: Monitoring & Uptime
features.description: Uptime Kuma dashboards, Nginx health checks, and network isolation for reliability.

features.title: Future Production Model
features.description: Dedicated Git control machines + redundant hosting servers for scalable client deployments.

engineeringNotes: ZFordDevs infrastructure is built with a security-first mindset: isolated networks, hardened SSH, strict firewall rules, and a controlled deployment pipeline. All systems are documented as credibility projects, ensuring repeatability and professional optics as the company scales.
